about.name: Beirut
about.info_text: Beirut, the capital city of Lebanon, is a fascinating and historic metropolis known for its rich culture, diverse heritage, and vibrant atmosphere. Situated on the Mediterranean coast, Beirut offers a unique blend of ancient traditions and modern influences. The city is famous for its lively nightlife, delicious cuisine, and a plethora of historical sites. Whether you're strolling through the ancient streets of the Old Town or enjoying the bustling waterfront, Beirut has something to captivate every visitor.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 2.4 million
Country: Lebanon
Time Zone: Eastern European Time (UTC+02:00)
Language: Arabic, French, English
Currency: Lebanese Pound (LBP)
about.climate_text: Beirut enjoys a Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers and mild, rainy winters. The city is known for its beautiful coastal views and pleasant weather, making it a fantastic year-round destination.

attractions_card.title: Pigeon Rocks (Raouche Rocks)
attractions_card.description: The Pigeon Rocks are natural sea stacks that rise from the Mediterranean near the Raouche district, offering stunning views and a popular sunset spot.

attractions_card.title: Beirut Souks
attractions_card.description: The Beirut Souks are a bustling shopping district with a variety of shops, boutiques, and restaurants, making it a hub of activity in the city.

attractions_card.title: National Museum of Beirut
attractions_card.description: The National Museum houses a remarkable collection of archaeological artifacts, showcasing Lebanon's rich history and heritage.

attractions_card.title: Beirut Corniche
attractions_card.description: The Corniche is a picturesque seaside promenade that stretches along the coastline, providing beautiful views and a pleasant place to walk and relax.

attractions_card.title: Jeita Grotto
attractions_card.description: The Jeita Grotto is a natural wonder, featuring a series of stunning limestone caves with crystal-clear underground lakes.

attractions_card.title: Downtown Beirut
attractions_card.description: Downtown Beirut is a modern district filled with shops, cafes, and cultural sites, where you can explore the city's contemporary side.

attractions_card.title: Mohammad Al-Amin Mosque
attractions_card.description: This grand mosque is a significant religious and architectural landmark in Beirut, known for its beautiful blue domes and stunning interior.

attractions_card.title: Byblos (Jbeil)
attractions_card.description: A short drive from Beirut, Byblos is an ancient city with historical ruins, charming streets, and a picturesque harbor.

food_card.title: Falafel
food_card.description: Falafel is a popular Lebanese street food made from ground chickpeas or fava beans, deep-fried to perfection and often served in pita bread.

food_card.title: Shawarma
food_card.description: Shawarma is a beloved Middle Eastern dish consisting of thinly sliced marinated meat, often served in a flatbread with various condiments.

food_card.title: Tabbouleh
food_card.description: Tabbouleh is a refreshing salad made with bulgur wheat, finely chopped parsley, mint, tomatoes, and a tangy lemon dressing.

food_card.title: Kibbeh
food_card.description: Kibbeh is a traditional Lebanese dish made from ground meat, bulgur, and spices, often shaped into patties or balls and either fried or baked.

food_card.title: Baklava
food_card.description: Baklava is a delectable dessert made of layers of filo pastry, chopped nuts, and sweet syrup or honey, creating a rich and sweet treat.

hotels_card.title: Le Gray Beirut
hotels_card.description: Le Gray is a luxury boutique hotel located in the heart of Beirut's downtown district, offering contemporary design and top-notch amenities.

hotels_card.title: Phoenicia Hotel Beirut
hotels_card.description: The Phoenicia Hotel is an iconic luxury hotel with a rich history, overlooking the Mediterranean and providing elegant accommodations and superb dining.

hotels_card.title: Four Seasons Hotel Beirut
hotels_card.description: The Four Seasons Hotel is a waterfront luxury hotel with stunning views, exceptional service, and an array of dining options.

hotels_card.title: Gefinor Rotana Beirut
hotels_card.description: Gefinor Rotana is a modern hotel offering comfortable rooms, a rooftop pool, and easy access to the city's attractions.

hotels_card.title: Radisson Blu Martinez Hotel, Beirut
hotels_card.description: The Radisson Blu Martinez Hotel is a contemporary hotel with a central location, providing comfortable accommodations and a rooftop pool.

transport_card.title: Beirut Rafic Hariri International Airport
transport_card.description: The Beirut Airport is the primary international gateway to Lebanon, serving both domestic and international flights.

transport_card.title: Public Transportation
transport_card.description: Beirut offers a range of public transportation options, including buses and shared taxis, making it easy to get around the city.

transport_card.title: Car Rentals
transport_card.description: Car rental agencies are available in Beirut for those who prefer to explore the city and its surroundings at their own pace.

transport_card.title: Walking and Biking
transport_card.description: Exploring Beirut by walking or biking is a great way to experience the city's vibrant streets and neighborhoods.
